channel.title: Flame_Designs | My first website {Development}
channel.description:
Hey everyone, I'm relatively new to this section of the forums, and thought that it would be fun to start learning web development. This site is going to be quite unappealing until I can get the hang of all of this stuff. I now have a website url for you to view the websites live! Please be patient as I learn how to do cross-platform screen fitting and resolution, but you can view it here: http://www.flame-designs.site90.com/ [u]Things/Languages I will be using:[/u] [ul][li]html[/li] [li]php[/li] [li]css[/li] [li][size=5pt]hexadecimal color codes[/size][/li] [li]Whatever draws my attention[/li][/ul] I suppose I could keep this open source if I wanted to, but my conventions would be so horrid and the code so sloppy and bad that I doubt anyone would want it, or even want to look at it for that matter. I'll give an update log of screenshots, things I implemented, things I plan on implementing, and sources of which I got new ideas from. And yes, I will definitely leech a few things, but not without studying the code first. This will be purely for fun and learning purposes. [code=Update Log] -[3/10/12] I looked at Mod Ruby's post, "So...you want to make a website?" -[3/10/12] Website started; I have no knowledge whatsoever of anything to do with website development, except that they are websites. -[3/10/12] Figured out how to add text in specific spots and how to align them left, right, and centered. -[3/11/12] Began understanding how to add pages and where to link them to. -[3/11/12] Added a column dedicated to the pages of the website. -[3/12/12] Added a contact-me form to the contact page of the website. This involved me using php as well. -[3/15/13] Learned how to source images in the html -[3/15/13] Added a column (which is quite ugly) to the left side of the site -[3/15/13] Moved the pages temporarily under the logo -[3/15/13] Minor performance/code update to the page referencing and overall site -[3/15/13] Began looking into socially acceptable programming conventions for web design -[3/15/13] Learned that it is possible to change the page title on each page. (the tidbit) -[3/15/13] Minor improvements and fixes to the main.css -[3/15/13] Total layout revamp! -[3/15/13] We now have a website url! [/code] [code=Predicted Updates (Apologies in advance if they sound dumb, unclear, or dumb)] - Align the pages so that they can be proportional to the rest of the website. - Come up with some way to make a drop-down menu for sub-pages. - Make the pages tab go on top of the column/divider - Fit the website to the entire screen with a decent resolution and theme [/code] [code=Pictures] - http://puu.sh/2gBGl - Home page - http://puu.sh/2gBGG - About Me page - http://puu.sh/2gBHo - Contact Me page - http://puu.sh/2ir47 - Little preview of how I'm attempting to set up the columns. [/code]
-[url=http://www.freecontactform.com/html_form.php]http://www.freecontactform.com/html_form.php[/url] - The code I used for the contact form -[url=http://css-tricks.com/text-blocks-over-image/]http://css-tricks.com/text-blocks-over-image/[/url] - The code that taught me how to overlay a color on top of text
For anyone who will ask why I've decided to post updates of minuscule importance into the log - that is because I strongly believe that the small updates are the most important, as those updates are the ones that get you going. [code=Credits] -Mod Ruby (for his post on website designing, and giving me tips along the way) -ox random xi / Andrew (for helping me understand and set up FTP clients) [/code] Thanks for reading, give me feedback and Yay/Nay below. :P

item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:10, topic:507440”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=625673.msg4258478#msg4258478 date=1363168592]

Considering layout is a key part of the appearance I don’t really think your post makes much sense, layout is incredibly important and should be focused on at all times.

No, I meant instead of starting with a “sketchy” layout, go straight for customization’s etc
[/quote]
My primary focus currently is to have full understanding of the code so I know how it works, and ultimately, improve it.[/quote]good for you cutie good to see you are taking this seriously. I wish I had the motivation to continue where I stopped in the web languages.

@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:40, topic:507440”]I’ve been wanting a MacBook for quite some time now.
I have no access to the Internet, and it doesn’t seem worth it, at least to me, to spend any more money to have it repaired or invest in any OS for the laptop.
I keep regular backups of the valued items on my computer, and the same day that I’d backed up the website was the day I decided to backup up everything. [size=4pt]Onto 3 flash drives.[/size][/quote]
Wouldn’t cost you a penny, Ubuntu is completely open source…

Read full topic

item.title: Flame_Designs | My first website {Development}
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:38, topic:507440”]tl;dr My hdd went out like a wet candle and blue screened on me. I’ve ran enough tests on it and fixed something somehow to the point that I can get to my desktop, but anything afterwards just makes it go into a vegetative state and shut down.
Even if it could be fixed, at this point I don’t want it to be. I’m getting a MacBook for my birthday, and I’ve just abused that computer. It was old and the highest rating was a 3.9 in the gaming/graphics card.
Thank you though. :)[/quote]
Ahh good choice, I’ve been against everything Apple for as far as I can remember, but I love my baby Macbook Air, the touchpad is insanely good.

Judging by that, it’s just a Windows problem, a simple reinstall would fix it. If not then it’ll be actual HDD related, I’d try running a SMART test before you do anything, download speedfan and it has one included. Windows does fragment over time and I’ve had a few cases where it gets so bad it’ll just refuse to function anymore. Seriously look into booting into a live Ubuntu OS though, it’ll take easily under an hour and if you value any of the data on there whatsoever you can retrieve it all in minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Flame_Designs | My first website {Development}
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

tl;dr My hdd went out like a wet candle and blue screened on me. I’ve ran enough tests on it and fixed something somehow to the point that I can get to my desktop, but anything afterwards just makes it go into a vegetative state and shut down.
Even if it could be fixed, at this point I don’t want it to be. I’m getting a MacBook for my birthday, and I’ve just abused that computer. It was old and the highest rating was a 3.9 in the gaming/graphics card.
Thank you though.

Read full topic

Oh and I’m also very good with hardware diagnostics, what exactly happened to your computer? It might just be a case of booting into a Ubuntu Live CD and copying the files elsewhere

item.title: Flame_Designs | My first website {Development}
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:34, topic:507440”]I reserve my Dropbox for things with a larger file size and if they are of utmost importance.
The backup I have is at about 3 days before my computer blitzed, so nothing ‘major’ was lost.
And Dropbox/other clouds are blocked at my school. :|[/quote]
Then also check out Bvckup, I have around 3TB of data on my primary desktop, but it’s kept all in sync on my home server with this, it can be set to backup when a change is detected, or at any specified interval. Highly recommend, absolutely free too.

Read full topic
